intro: Chaetonychia echinata, commonly known as the spiny chaetonychia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, spiny stems and showy, pink or purple flowers. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
